detailed_description: The engine experiences a noticeable misfire when the driver accelerates above 3000 RPM, causing a loss of power and rough idle.
The brake pedal feels soft and travels further than normal, reducing braking efficiency.
The vehicle's battery voltage does not increase while the engine is running, indicating a charging system fault.
The transmission slips out of gear during acceleration, causing a sudden drop in engine RPM.
The A/C system blows warm air despite the compressor engaging, indicating a refrigerant or component issue.

The ABS indicator illuminates on the dashboard, suggesting a sensor or module malfunction.

The engine cranks but does not start due to insufficient fuel pressure from a faulty pump.

A humming noise increases with vehicle speed, typical of a worn rear wheel bearing.
Red fluid is spotted beneath the vehicle, indicating a leak in the transmission system.
Cabin heating fails to produce warm air despite the engine reaching operating temperature.
Engine misfires and runs poorly due to carbon-fouled spark plugs.
Intermittent starting issues caused by corrosion or looseness at the battery terminals.
The clutch engages but slips under load, especially during uphill acceleration.
Uneven tire wear detected, recommending a rotation to extend tire life.
Reduced engine performance due to a heavily dirty air intake filter.
A cracked radiator hose leaks coolant, risking overheating if not replaced promptly.
Low beam headlights remain dim regardless of the dimmer switch position, indicating a switch fault.

problem_name: Faulty fuel injector causing rough idle
detailed_description: The engine idles inconsistently due to a clogged fuel injector, leading to vibration and decreased fuel efficiency.

problem_name: Worn brake pads and rotor vibration
detailed_description: Brake pads are below minimum thickness, and the rotor shows scoring, causing pulsation when braking.

problem_name: Leaking coolant hose in the radiator
detailed_description: A cracked upper radiator hose is leaking coolant, leading to overheating risk.

problem_name: Malfunctioning ABS sensor on front left wheel

Fluid level is below the mark and appears dark, indicating possible internal wear.

problem_name: Failed oxygen sensor leading to rich fuel mixture
detailed_description: The upstream O2 sensor is stuck rich, causing increased emissions and fuel consumption.

problem_name: Exhaust manifold leak near the gasket

System pressure is low, resulting in weak cooling performance.
